main event: An unusual sighting of a bright, oblong object that appeared and disappeared rapidly in the sky was reported on May 2, 1959.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar for approximately 10 minutes covering about 13 miles without visual confirmation., The report was made by Colonel John D. Whitted from the Mid-Continental Air Defense Force., The target was described as a bright luminous, disc-shaped object that was 20-30 feet in diameter and moved at high speed., The sighting lasted for 3-5 minutes and was made at an estimated altitude above 6000 feet., The source of the report is considered credible with a detailed account from a reliable observer.
